categories.summary: The chat contains a single message from user "ash" providing a debugging tip for accessing GLB file URLs in edit mode. The user suggests that when a GLB file is selected in edit mode, developers can access its URL by typing either "app" or "entity" in the console. This appears to be a quick tip for developers working with 3D models in a web-based editor.

The chat segment shows minimal technical discussion. There appears to be some community concern about Hyperfy's development status and communication. Roustan responded to questions by directing users to other Discord channels where they can find information about ongoing development and user-created worlds. The conversation indicates there may be a Github integration bot that posts updates, which Agent12 noted hasn't been active recently. Overall, this segment contains very little substantive technical content, mostly consisting of community members asking about project status and direction.

The chat segment is very brief with minimal technical discussion. It contains only a few messages: a link to an Instagram reel shared by vox, two empty messages from Fibelius, a post from Sceth iii about an environmental asset they worked on and optimized for rendering (with a link to their Twitter/X post), and a compliment from fractilians. There is no substantial technical discussion, problem-solving, or decision-making in this segment.

# Analysis of Discord Chat in "ğŸŒ†â”‚share" Channel

## 1. Summary
The chat segment contains two main announcements. First, Sceth iii shared a link to their X (Twitter) post without additional context. Second, odds announced the soft launch of Edify Engine, a multi-tenant platform built on Hyperfy that simplifies world creation. Edify Engine targets creators without technical backgrounds who struggle with GitHub, hosting setup, and domain configuration. Key features include: a user dashboard for server management, one-click domain setup with automatic DNS configuration, a browser-based code editor for direct file manipulation, automatic subdomain provisioning, and SOL integration for purchases (with hosting handled via credit card). The platform is currently in soft launch within the Hyperfy community, with plans for expansion in 2026. The announcement received positive feedback from maximus.

## 2. FAQ
